results.title: Three Mile Creek (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Alyssa Rothwell and Department of Visual Communication, RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
This CD ROM is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by the experience of growing up in rural Australia. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create a sense of being there. A contemplative approach is the key to enjoying the stories. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Recommended for use on a Power MacIntosh with a minimum of 15MB free RAM.

group_siblings.title: Still life with aeroplane
group_siblings.creator_credit: Lloyd Weir, Jeremy Parker, Robyn Blake, David Atkinson and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Three Mile Creek
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. Three Mile Creek is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by an experience of growing up in rural northern NSW. The aim is to transport the participant into what is a distinctively Australian time and place, with the child who lives on the farm as their guide.
A contemplative approach is the key to appreciating the stories. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create the sense of being there

results.title: Three men made history
results.creator_credit: John Miller, Frank Green, Ace Films and British Gas Council
results.brief_description: The history of minting money in Great Britain. Special emphasis is laid on the work of Boulton, Watt and Murdock, and contemporary processes are shown in detail. The film has reproductions of ancient coins, with special emphasis on findings in Great Britain. The famous Maundy money distributed yearly by the King is also included.

results.title: Three men and a baby (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Nimoy, Robert W. Cort, Ted Field and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The lives of three confirmed Manhattan bachelors are thrown into confusion when a baby girl is left at their front door. A lively remake of the 1985 French comedy “Three men and a cradle”. Starring Ted Danson, Tom Selleck and Steve Guttenberg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Nimoy, Robert W. Cort, Ted Field and Touchstone Pictures

results.title: Three men and a baby
results.creator_credit: Leonard Nimoy, Robert W. Cort, Ted Field and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Entertaining light-hearted comedy about three bachelors living in a New York apartment whose lives are suddenly and dramatically changed when a baby is left on their doorstep. The three are somewhat challenged in their new role of parenthood and it is the interaction between them that provides most of the humour. Stars Tom Selleck, Steve Guttenberg and Ted Danson in the lead roles with Nancy Travis, Margaret Colin and Celeste Holm.

results.title: Three looms waiting (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ronald Smedley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”
Portrait of an English drama teacher, Dorothy Heathcote. Shows her work in Tyneside with a variety of young people from an approved school, a junior school, and a hospital for the mentally handicapped.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Three little words
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Tin Pan Alley’s legendary songwriting team of Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby are given the MGM treatment here by Busby Berkeley and musical stars Fred Astaire and Red Skelton, although the film is as much about the performances of the stellar cast as it is about the lives of Kalmar and Ruby. It’s 1919 and vaudeville is in full swing. Bert’s (Astaire) dance career is going well (despite his aspirations to be a musician), ably supported by vaudeville wife Jessie (Vera-Ellen), and obtaining success with numbers such as “Mrs and Mrs Hoofer at Home”. Fate steps in when Bert must take up the more sedentary activity of writing lyrics after injuring his knee. He eventually meets Harry Ruby, a fellow lyricist and frustrated baseball player, and the two pool their talents and reach immediate success writing hits for Broadway and the movies. Their fairytale rise to fame is eventually undone by a trivial misunderstanding, and highlights the rocky nature of their professional and personal relationship. Their future as a successful songwriting team is left in the hands of the women who love them, and who have the potential to reunite them. Cameos are provided by Phil Regan and Harry Mendoza as themselves. Songs include “I Wanna be loved by you”, “Who’s sorry now” and “Thinking of you”.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Feature films → Feature films - United States

results.title: Three Little Pigs
results.brief_description: The two pigs building houses of hay and sticks scoff at their brother, building the brick house. But when the wolf comes around and blows their houses down (after trickery like dressing as a foundling sheep fails), they run to their brother’s house. And throughout, they sing the classic song, “Who’s Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?”.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.
